page.title: 13LIDEN ESTATE EAST SWINDON
page.content: The part of Liden to the east of Liden Drive is mainly residential but contains some interesting features.{Liden Lagoon}contains two islands,one inhabited by{rabbits}.The lagoon provides a home ,temporary or permanent,for many{birds}and is used for organised{fishing and canoe {training}.Running beside the Lagoon is the A 419 which follows the line of the old{Roman Road,Ermin Way}.To the north the industrial estate contains {warehouse and distribution firms. Between the lagoon and the industrial estate is Wick Farmhouse,built in the 1400's,it was once a{nunnery}offering travellers a resting place in return for work.It is rumoured that after being attacked by a hunter,one of the nuns killed herself and now she{haunts the house.
